content:
For "display emoji reactions as text":

  • I think we can show the text as baby bottle rather than :baby_bottle: in the reaction bubble
  • Should this just be "display emoji as text"? I imagine anyone that wants the reactions as text will also want the emoji in messages as text. Or is this just technically challenging? (If it is even slightly technically challenging, I expect it is not worth it, I'm not sure how many people use this feature.)

Yes to the first. On the second, I agree with your caution. I could imagine people want to know the text of the reactions, but are happy to just ignore emoji in messages, where emoji usually are somewhat redundant.

It's not super technically challenging, and yes, the plan is to change it to just "emoji as text". We just haven't worked on it. For reference, apparently Slack also has this feature, so it's something that their userbase has felt important as well:

pasted image
Yeah, to be clear, I think we should eventually just turn this off globally, I just think it's not super urgent.
Yeah. Just to give you a sense, I would estimate probably <10 lines of code to implement it in message bodies.
Would the changes be client-side, server-side, or a little of both?
It will require just a little bit of CSS tweaking with some JS code.
